maintain a track parallel to the one for which you have already been cleared.

question: In radiotelephony communication, which word or phrase shall be used if you want to say: "Reduce your rate of speech"?
Which is the High Frequency (HF) radio frequency band?
According ICAO Annex 10 Vol. II, "Broadcast" is defined as ...
options: two-way communication between aircraft and stations or locations on the surface of the earth.
one-way communication from aircraft to stations or locations on the surface of the earth.
one-way communication from stations or locations on the surface of the earth to aircraft.
a transmission of information relating to air navigation that is not addressed to a specific station or stations.

question: Select the air traffic service in charge of control of local traffic, take-offs and landings at an airport:
In accordance with ICAO radiotelephony communication procedures what is the meaning of the phrase "CONFIRM"?
options: My last transmission is ended, and I expect a response from you in due time
I have received your: clearance, instruction, action, information
I request verification of: a clearance, instruction, action, information
Examine a system or procedure to identify an obvious or possible problem

question: Your flight plan has been filed with the call sign "GOLF ALFA CHARLIE ZULU GOLF". At 1515, Air Traffic Control instructed you to "CHANGE YOUR CALLSIGN TO SKYFALL ZULU GOLF" with no additional information. When should you change back to using "GOLF ALFA CHARLIE ZULU GOLF"?
options: Automatically on passing the next reporting point, or when instructed by ATC to do so
When instructed by ATC to do so, or automatically at 1545
Automatically on making the next frequency change, or when instructed by ATC to do so
Only when instructed to "REVERT TO FLIGHTPLAN CALLSIGN GOLF ALFA CHARLIE ZULU GOLF."

question: When is an aircraft station allowed to use its abbreviated call sign?
options: Only after satisfactory communication has been established.
After it has been addressed in this manner by the aeronautical ground station.
Provided no confusion is likely to result.

question: With your position approximately 10 NM east of airfield Cedar Creek, your position report would be:
options: "D-IABC ZERO NINE ZERO ONE ZERO CEDAR CREEK"
"D-IABC CEDAR CREEKTEN MILES ZERO NINE ZERO"
"D-IABC POSITION TEN MILES EAST OF CEDAR CREEK"

question: The correct way to transmit the VHF channel 128.100 in radiotelephony communication is ...
What does the word "REPORT" mean?
options: Repeat all of this message back to me exactly as received

The clearance "cleared for immediate take-off runway 03" is ...
An "Automatic Terminal Information Service" provides ...
options: routine information to arriving and departing aircraft by means of continuous and repetitive broadcast.
current meteorological and operational information essential for the safety of the air navigation within a FIR.
information concerning en-route weather phenomena which may effect the safety of aircraft operation.
weather reports related to a specific number of aerodromes located within a flight information region (FIR).

question: What does the abbreviation "SSR" mean?
The priority of the pilot's message "request QDM" is:
options: less than "request climb to flight level ... "

question: In which cases can the name of a location or call sign suffix be omitted? 1. If communication has been established. 2. If it will NOT cause any confusion. 3. If it is allowed by the Authority. 4.If a VFR flight plan has been filed.
"STOP SQUAWK CHARLIE, WRONG INDICATION" That means the controller ...
options: has an incorrect position indication for your aircraft on his/her primary radar.
is informing you that he/she can only determine your bearing within 10 degrees.
wants you to switch off your transponder completely.
wants you to deselect the altitude reporting function on your transponder.

question: Which phrase shall be used if you want to say "Pass me the following information ( ... )"?
In radiotelephony communication, which word shall be used to indicate that an error has been made in a transmission or message?
What is the radiotelephony call sign for the aeronautical station providing flight information service?
What is the correct way of spelling out HB-JYC in a radio message?
If you are requested to "REPORT FLIGHT CONDITIONS", what does that mean?
options: Indicate if visibility is sufficient for landing
Indicate whether you are flying in IMC or in VMC
Indicate weather conditions as wind, visibility, temperature
Indicate whether you are flying IFR or VFR

question: What is the correct way of transmitting altitude 4300?
The VHF frequency band includes which pair of frequencies?
What does the term "significant point" mean?
options: A specified geographical position used to define an area navigation route or the flight path of an aircraft employing area navigation. 4
A term used to define a specified and identifiable location on the manoeuvring area of an aerodrome.
A defined position on an aerodrome used for the calibration of the inertial navigation system.
A signal indicating the direction of the runway-in-use.

question: Which of the following only lists instructions and information that should always be read back?
options: SSR code, QNH, take-off clearance, and speed instructions
QNH, SSR code, and approach aid serviceability
ATC clearance, speed instructions, and runway state information

question: The correct reply of aircraft D-IABC on the following ATC instruction is: "D-BC, when passing 1500 ft, contact Lille Approach 126.475"
Which of the following is correct as regards the use of the words "OVER" and/or "OUT"?
options: "OVER" and "OUT" are NOT normally used in VHF communications
"OVER" has to be used at the end of every VHF transmission to indicate that the transmission is over and that an answer is expected
"OVER" and "OUT" are NOT normally used in HF communications if SELCAL is available
"Out" at the end of a transmission indicates that you are leaving a VHF frequency

question: In case of an aircraft is unable to perform a cleared RNAV departure ONEGO 2A, the correct phrase to inform ATC would be:
options: "NEGATIVE ONEGO two alpha departure due RNAV type"
"UNABLE ONEGO two alpha departure due RNAV type"

question: When receiving a message via Aircraft Communication Addressing Reporting System (ACARS) reading "MAINTAIN PRESENT SPEED", the correct phrase for response would be:
The abbreviation "MSA" stands for:
What is the correct suffix to use when establishing radio contact with an area control centre?
What does the phrase "READ BACK" mean?
options: Did you correctly receive this message?
Repeat all, or the specified part, of this message back to me exactly as received
Let me know that you have received and understood this message

question: An aircraft call sign can be abbreviated after satisfactory communication has been established, no confusion is likely to arise, and ...
options: after the aircraft station and ground station agree to use the abbreviated call sign.
if the aircraft station deems it necessary to call the ground station with its abbreviated call sign.
if there are a lot of other communications on the frequency.
after the abbreviated call sign has been used by the ground station.

question: What radiotelephony transmission should be made when an aircraft starts a descent?

options: "Climbing to two thousand five hundred feet"

question: A departing VFR flight is being handled by approach control. Upon reaching the boundary of the area over which the approach control has responsibility, the pilot should ...
options: report that he/she is leaving the area of jurisdiction.
request a clearance to leave controlled airspace.
free-call the en-route frequency requesting an appropriate level of ATC service.
report the intended route of the flight and when he/she will make a position report.

options: It is situated two bands below the SHF band and contains frequency 288.0 MHZ
It is called the VLF band and contains frequency 130.450 kHz
It is immediately above the MF band and its frequencies are measured in MHz
It is immediately below the UHF band and its frequencies are measured in kHz

question: To which frequency bands do the frequencies 118.000 - 136.975 MHz of the Aeronautical Mobile Service belong?
